[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The News Aggregation and Library Portal System (NALPS) provides aggregated news, library resources, and real-time updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: NALPS supports news aggregation, recommendations, multilingual content, offline reading, and social sharing.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: NALPS integrates with news APIs, library databases, and social media.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: NALPS provides a responsive web and mobile UI.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: NALPS supports desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: NALPS uses REST APIs, OAuth authentication, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: NALPS ensures real-time updates via WebSockets and push notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: NALPS is optimized for offline reading and recommendations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: NALPS supports article downloads, real-time updates, and alerts.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: NALPS adapts content based on user preferences.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: NALPS connects with translation and recommendation APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: NALPS aggregates news, offers recommendations, supports multiple languages, and enables offline reading and sharing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: NALPS designed for general readers, investors, researchers, and health enthusiasts.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Offline access is limited to saved articles. Real-time updates require the internet.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: NALPS relies on external APIs for news aggregation, cloud storage, and push notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: News Aggregation: Collecting news from multiple sources.
Recommendations: Suggested news based on interests.
Offline Reading: Viewing saved articles without the internet.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: NALPS: News Aggregation and Library Portal System

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall aggregate news from multiple sources.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect to library databases for full-text access.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall allow article sharing on social media.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to browse, filter, and search news by topic, source, language, and region (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable users to save and sync news articles for offline reading (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall send push notifications and recommendations based on reading history (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for browsing, filtering, and reading news.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall display articles within 2 seconds under normal load.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store aggregated news articles with metadata, user preferences, and offline content.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store user-defined alerts and recommendations.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use cloud storage for scalability and real-time updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with GDPR and data privacy regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure data storage and transmission using encryption.

[SEC] 3. Verification: System tests validate news aggregation accuracy, UI responsiveness, search precision, and offline reading reliability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance reports.
[SEC] 5. References: News aggregation standards, library access policies, and GDPR compliance guidelines.
